wikipedia_page.main: Arthur James Johnes (4 February 1809 – 23 July 1871) was an English county court judge.

link_mentions.page: Cambrian Quarterly Magazine and Celtic Repertory
response: The principal founder of the magazine was Rice Pryce Buckley Williames who also served as its first editor. His co-proprietor was Anthony Ashley Cooper, later Lord Shaftsbury. Thomas Price, a cleric and historian who was instrumental in reviving the Eisteddfod, was also a founder. The magazine was promoted by county court judge Arthur James Johnes.
